title: SteelSeries Apex Pro Gen 3 vs Tecware Spectre 75
subtitle: High-end performance vs Feature-packed budget board
verdict: Apex Pro Gen 3 repousse les limites avec ses switches magnétiques nouvelle génération et son écran OLED ; le Tecware Spectre 75 offre une expérience mécanique moderne, une grande modularité à prix choc.

a.name: SteelSeries Apex Pro Gen 3 (Pro TKL Wired)
a.short: OmniPoint 3.0 Hall-effect magnetic switches, per-key adjustable actuation, OLED display – high-performance esports gear.
pros: Ultra-fast OmniPoint 3.0 switches with configurable actuation (0.1–4 mm)
OLED smart display and built-in presets (Rapid Trigger, Protection Mode, Rapid Tap/SOCD)

b.name: Tecware Spectre 75 (Wireless/Wired)
b.short: Compact 75% mechanical with LCD screen, hot-swap switches, triple connectivity, long battery life, and premium gasket-mount feel.
pros: Triple connectivity: wired USB-C, Bluetooth 5.0, 2.4GHz wireless
LCD customizable screen, per-key RGB, programmable via onboard or software
Hot-swap 5-pin switch sockets, PBT double-shot keycaps, 4000 mAh battery

table.b: Tecware Candy Red (linear) or Cocoa Brown (tactile), pre-lubed, hot-swap
Per-key RGB + LCD screen (customizable, shows system info/GIF)
Plastic, gasket mount, multilayer foam, adjustable feet

table.a: OLED display, Rapid Trigger, Protection Mode, software macro
table.b: Customizable LCD screen, macro, 19 lighting modes, multi-device switch
Gamers, débutants, étudiants recherchant modularité à petit prix
